headline: Midwest Salisbury Steak
description: This Salisbury steak recipe uses ground sirloin to get a leaner, meatier-tasting main dish with enough mushroom and onion gravy to top your sides, too.
name: Midwest Salisbury Steak
recipeIngredient: 0.5 (1 ounce) package dry onion soup mix
0.5 (1 ounce) package dry onion soup mix
salt and ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Make the patties: Mix ground sirloin, panko bread crumbs, egg, milk, 1/2 packet onion soup mix, Worcestershire sauce, and black pepper together in a large bowl; shape into 5 patties.
Heat a skillet over medium heat. Cook patties in the hot skillet until browned, 3 to 5 minutes per side.

Make the gravy: Melt butter in a separate skillet over medium-high heat. Sauté mushrooms and onion in melted butter until tender, about 5 minutes. Stir flour and remaining 1/2 packet onion soup mix into mushroom mixture until combined. Gradually add beef stock and water, stirring continually, until simmering. Reduce heat to medium; cook, stirring frequently, until gravy has thickened, about 4 to 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Place browned patties into gravy; simmer until very tender, about 30 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read 160 degrees F (70 degrees C).

review.reviewBody: I skipped the package of onion soup mix and used onion and garlic seasoning instead. Also used unsalted butter and some Georgia wine in the gravy. This was absolutely delicious. I am 74 and made this for my wife and I. The extra gravy will go well with the leftover patties on toast tomorrow.

The recipe looked a little too salty, so I left out the Worcester sauce and used vegetable broth instead of beef broth. The taste and texture was divine. I served it on top of mashed potatoes that I made with the leftover broth. Will make again!
Easy and delicious but just a bit salty. Loved it…thank you.
Turned out delicious. I put it over some mashed potatoes. Everyone enjoyed it
WOW!! ABSOLUTELY DEVINE. LOVE LOVE. THERE WAS NOTHING LEFT. VERY GOOD AND THANK YOU FOR A GREAT DINNER.
Pretty decent as written. Add garlic, salt, used my gut on W sauce, red pepper, cornstarch instead of flour, 1/2 cup more beef stock, 1/2 cup less water, and double up on butter for gravy.
It was ok. Needed more flavor. It could have been that I used 73/27 ground hamburger too.
Very tasty recipe. It is mushroom season here so I used some wild ones and the sauce turned out great. I will be using this recipe again.

Flavorful and easy to make. This recipe was easy to adapt for my Keto diet. Made my own bread crumbs from Keto burger buns, I used 80/20 ground beef, and keto wheat flour. The gravy and patties turn out great. I will repeat this recipe regularly.
This is the best salisbury steak I've ever tried. Amazing!!! Couldn't ask for a better meal

Absolutely delicious! I followed the recipe EXACTLY as written, and my husband liked it so much, he wanted to eat the extra patties for breakfast the following morning! Now, when we go "bulk" shopping, I buy 10 lbs of ground sirloin, and make up the patties in a big batch, then seal them up in portions with my seal a meal, so that whenever he wants them, all I have to do is defrost the patties and make the gravy. Thank you!
Great recipe. Would make again.
Delicious wouldn’t change a thing!!

I've made this several times but I cook the onions and mushroom for a little while before taking them out and cooking the patty. Then I put the mush/onion back in with the broth and simmer. We like it that way!

I made this last night (after my hubby mentioned he didn’t like Salisbury steak). I didn’t have mushrooms for the gravy, so I made my own using a mushroom gravy mix, onions, andthe onion soup mix. It came out so good! Hubby actually ended up liking it, a lot! Saved to my favorites! Will definitely be more prepared next time I plan on making it!
Pretty good but the gravy was too light. Could have used some browning sauce but I was out.
The gravy was actually kind of bland so I had to add 2 beef bouillon cubes.

I made the recipe as written, with only three changes. I, too, used the dry beefy onion soup mix and golden mushroom soup. I made four quarter pound patties instead of five, and they browned beautifully and came out firm like you might expect steak to be. The gravy was delicious and I wouldn't change that, but next time I'll increase the seasonings for the patties. Served with garlic mashed potatoes and winter squash it was sooo good. Note that the patties can be assembled earlier in the day and refrigerated until ready to be cooked. Makes dinner time a little less hectic.
I didn't care for it, too much onion soup mix for my liking, also the patties were tough, they need more simmer time in the gravy.
Fairly quick and easy week night meal. My family loved it!
Easy weeknight meal, the family loved it, I didn't change a thing.

I tried 3 different recipes from Allrecipes. Midwest Salisbury Steak was by far the family’s favorite. It is delicious. We’ve had it with mash & baked potatoes. Next day if there is any left we have it over rice.
Unbelievable recipe! My hubby just loves it!! This is about the 4th time I made it.

I loved it. Only thing I added was 1/2 of an jalapeño pepper that I needed to use. Chopped very fine.
But what is with the Sodium content:
6581 mg per serving?

I made this tonight with a few modifications. I didn’t have sirloin, so I used ground turkey, I didn’t have Worcestershire sauce so I used vinegar, I didn’t have onion soup packets so I used my onion gravy packet. I didn’t have sweet onion, so I used yellow onion. I did not use mushrooms because I don’t like them. When it says put the patties in the pan, I added 2 tbsp of butter first and then I added the patties. I used seasoned Panko bread crumbs. This was an amazing dish, even with all of my substitutes!
Great recipe, family loved it

Delicious and easy to make! I followed the directions exactly and doubled the recipe. Next time I make this I will leave out the water so hopefully the gravy will be thicker. Served with real mashed potatoes and homemade coleslaw with fresh fruit for dessert. Wonderful dinner!

Just wow! This is very probably the best Salisbury steak I've ever had. The only change was to eliminate the mushrooms. And that only cause I didn't have any. My husband said it was the best gravy and asked if I could make just the gravy for french fries. Yesterday we went grocery shopping and he asked me to make the Salisbury steak again. It's so rare that he asks for something in particular, so I knew he really liked it. Oh, and this time with the mushrooms. This one is definitely a keeper!
Very Very good. I didn't have the onion soup mix so I used some dried brown gravy mix and dried onions. Worked great.
This recipe is amazing!
Love it! We double the recipe because my family of 4 gobble it up and asks for seconds. So good. Sometimes I do put it in the crockpot if running low on time.

A solid 5 stars! The only thing I changed was I used Italian bread crumbs because that is what I had and I used beef broth...again, that is what I had. Very tasty. Had with mashed potatoes and fresh asparagus. Added to my main course rotation.
Loved this recipe and the homeade gravy! If my boyfriend loved mushrooms as much as me that would’ve been a MUST!
Big hit with the family! Only change was omitting the mushrooms, did not have on hand. Husband said to make sure I added this to the menu rotation. Will do!

This is an excellent recipe. I did modify it slightly...used beef onion soup mix, 3/4 of the ground sirloin and the other 1/4 of the meat was sweet Italian sausage I had leftover and wanted to use up. We were also out of sweet onions so I used a red onion. I served this with mashed potatoes and sautéed spinach. A lovely meal on a cold winter evening.
This is a very good recipe. We love Salisbury steak but never got the gravy down. This is by the best the closest. My bride is very picky and she even loves it. Thank you
Tried it for the first time, and it was a massive hit.
Good, comfort style food.

Easy and delicous. Like another reviewer stated, I am not sure why you dilute the stock with water. I did it, but won't do that next time as the more flavor the better. Second time I made this the sauce didn't thicken quite like I would like so I added a bit of cornstarch mixed with water and it thickened right up.
I’ve made this twice and my husband absolutely loves it! I also used beefy onion soup mix with all beef broth and no water. Will try adding garlic next time. Yummmmm!
Didn’t make any changes. I’m a non-cook and it was easy enough for me to follow and my family enjoyed.
Turned out very well. Everyone loved it. Will definitely make it again!
The only thing I did different is use 2lbs angus ground beef and I doubled the recipe without the mushrooms and turned out amazing! And the gravy was delicious
Soooooo dang good!
Delicious & Husband approved! No changes to the recipe. Easy to prepare. This will be my go to recipe for Salisbury Steak from now on.
Excellent!! The first time I’ve made Salisbury steak! Definitely will fix again!
It was pretty good. Although I've never heard of any sort of edible meat referred to as "firm and gray" kinda threw me off..
Only change I made was added 1/4 cup of red cooking wine.
I really don’t think you can beat this recipe for Salisbury Steak. I’ve made this several times, as written, and I’ll make it again. Very good!
I used beef bouillon instead of beef broth.

This is a simple recipe that packs a lot of flavor with simple components. Maybe more can be done with the beef potion, however simplicity speaks a ton. The gravy was amazing. Followed it strictly, will ad lib next time. Paired with potatoes and mixed veggies. This can be made relatively quickly.

Delicious !!!!! I used beefy onion dry Liptons soup mix and I didn’t beat the egg as instructed but just put it in the meat mixture and mixed by hand like making a meat loaf. My husband was over the moon about this.

It is tasty-much better than the box version. My husband said the meat is good-he can tell it's not from the box. I shared the recipe with my grand daughters in hopes they will make some for themselves. Thank you for sharing.
This is a really great and easy recipe. I used a beefy onion dry box instead and it came out good.
Absolutely delicious. My family loved it!
This was the best recipe. My son and I loved it and I will definitely make it again and it's such a great comfort food.

Excellent. Used lower sodium broth. Did not use salt. 
Will make again and again.
I love this recipe! I typically serve over mashed potatoes. You can also make meatballs out of the same recipe. Delish!

I did the same thing Jeffrey did, used cream of mushroom in place of the flour and mushroom, and just a tad over a cup of beef broth. I also used kitchen bouquet Browning and seasoning sauce to make the gravy Brown. Added garlic to the meat. 
Quick easy and great for quarantine meals. I could have made the Patty smaller but I got about a week's worth of food.

Family LOVED it. I made a few substitutions/omissions - I didn't have onion soup mix or beef bouillon and probably wouldn't have used either because of ingredients (ie. MSG) so I used onion powder only. I only used beef broth as well, I omitted the water. I also didn't have Worcestershire but was able to find how to make a substitute (soy sauce, lemon juice, sugar, & hot sauce). Next time, I'll have mushrooms but not change anything else. So, so good! You won't regret making it. My family is already asked when we are having it again!
May need to add a little more flour. I add 4 tbls. It was huge hit with fam.
Great recipe. Followed exactly except I used 1 lb of ground turkey. Turned out great!

Minor changes. Used all beef broth and added Worcestershire
Sauce to sauce as was suggested by others.
We enjoyed my meat broke up but tasted delicious
I used low sodium ingredients. I've made Salisbury Steaks this way for years, and they're delicious! What, may I ask, makes them Midwestern? Nevertheless, this is a terrific recipe.

Just made this tonight and I made some changes. Used 2lbs of ground beef and pork, then just doubled the rest of the ingredients except the beef stock and water. Which I am so glad I did because the gravy was the perfect consistency. This is definitely a new item on our dinner menu
Followed the recipe and it was great! Family loved it.
Easy and a hit at home
It was delicious. We added more onions and I think that added to the flavor.

Will definitely make it again! Very easy. I did take one suggestion of mixing together the ingredients for the patties before adding it to the ground sirloin being careful to not over mix and make the patties too tough or hard. They were perfect. Thank you for this timeless classic.
This was absolutely fantastic! Thank you for the fabulous dinner idea!

My husband loved it! I made this last weekend and he's already asking me to make again. The meatloaf ingredients and cooking instructions were not changed however, my husband insisted I simmer in my gravy recipe he has grown use to. It's looking like this is the Midwest Steak Recipe for me and my family!
Absolutely delicious and fun to make. Girls had fun in the kitchen and we all loved it,

I made this with some of the suggestions from others and really enjoyed it. My family loved it! I added a lot of mushrooms and onions & garlic. I also increased the worchestershire sauce. As we say in Hawaii, it was "Onolicious"!

I will be making this again. I did have a few changes that I made. I used reg. ground beef as I didn't have Sirloin. I used Italian bread crumbs instead of Panko. In the gravy mixture I added green bell peppers just for added flavor and to pack in more veggies. Husband loved it and said the meat was nice and tender. I served this over egg noodles.

This recipe was very easy and very flexible. I didn't have worcestershire sauce, so I substituted soy sauce, plus a little barbecue sauce and about a quarter cup of red wine. I also used leftover diced onions rather than slicing one. We really enjoyed the flavor of the gray. I served the steaks with cheesy mashed potatoes and a blue cheese and tomato salad. With just the two of us, we each eat one and half patties and are looking forward to eating the remaining ones as open face sandwiches or on buns for a lunch soon.

I made this for dinner tonight. My husband and the kids loved it. Their only complaint was that I didn't make enough. We had to run to a sports event, so I didn't simmer the patties in the pan for 30 minutes. Instead, I used the slow cooker to finish it off while we were at the game. I made the patties and the gravy according to the recipe, placed the patties in the slow cooker, poured the gravy over it, and set the cooker on Low for an hour and a half. It turned out great.

this was absolutely delicious. the only reason I'm giving it 4 out of 5 stars is the lack of garlic.
I made it for family dinner over at my parents. we all loved it.
My husband and I loved it! An easy recipe to follow, not too time consuming with prepping.
I tweeted the receipt a little while sauté the onions and mushrooms I added mince garlic so good
Great but I tweaked too. Like another reviewer M. Burgess, I used golden mushroom soup instead of fresh mushrooms.
Instead of onion soup mix I used 2 tablespoons of dry chopped onions
It is a fabulous recipe..my family raved about it and I will definitely make it in the future. I don't eat red meat often... Probably less than once every 3-6 months. Very tasty though
Great recipe. I had to tweak it to make it to our family likings but it was a great recipe! Will make again
Made exactly as written and was a great comfort food meal. Especially liked the seasoning in the meat, will definitely make again! Thank you for the recipe!

thought it was very very good. I doubled the recipe and separated the meat into 12 patties, cooked them over stovetop then transferred them to oven safe aluminum bakeware and topped with the sauce. has to make the sauce without mushrooms as hubby doesn't eat mushrooms (extremely picky eater) and his only suggestion was to use less onion in the sauce. nevertheless, I thought it was a great recipe. will definitely make again. it was an awesome recipe to make ahead and freeze for later

I made a double batch, husband and 6y/o son loved it. Patties are great as is though a little salty I thought, but no one complained. My boys love meat, so I used 2# burger and made 6 thick patties on either egg noodles or mashed potatoes (picky eaters). Probably could have not straight doubled the soup mix and kept some for the sauce (I forgot about the mix going in the sauce). I edited the sauce due to family preferences and available ingredients. Sauteed diced onion and green pepper with garlic, then added cream of mush and 2 cans beef broth. As a normal cooking person can tell already, that didnt thicken well. Could have used flour, or just extra cool time; by the time I was putting away leftovers it was nice and thick. Flavor was fantastic, pretty well perfect. Everyone is full and I'm glad we have leftovers

This was delightful. Sooo good and super easy to make. Great recipe. I used a can of cream of mushroom soup and added some flour and beef broth - really really really good. Next time will add some sautéed asparagus to the plate.
Very good!! Will make it again.

I will admit that I used 80% chuck instead of sirloin and used the grease to sub 2 tbsp of butter used to make the gravy. I also used the same pan to make the gravy as browning beef to save cleaning and because why not use that flavor? Aside from that everything was the same. This recipe is pretty good as written. I only give four stars because I found the onion flavor too prominent. Next time I will probably only use half an onion instead of a whole one but there will definitely be a next time. This makes a good dinner with not too much effort!

This was so tasty! Family requested this be 
put on the regular rotations for cold weather feel good foods. Followed recipe exactly, easy to make, and smiles all around. Thanks for sharing it!

I made this exactly as the recipe, except for a bit more Worstershire sauce. I've always used my own similar recipe but I wanted to try something new. Served it with mashed potatoes and corn, hubby's fave. I will e using this recipe from now on! Thank you, Leann T. It was FAB!!
Delicious! Very rich and flavorful. I followed the directions and the patties were cooked perfectly.

I've made this several times and love it. We only use ground venision, so no drippings at all, just add a little olive oil to pan to cook in. I didn't use any milk or W sauce as I was out. Wasn't a need for it. I add a hand full of crushed french fried onions to the burgers. Sometimes I add the diced onion, sometimes don't.

I followed the recipe as written. My husband and my 91 year old father both enjoyed this dish. The onion soup added good flavor. My husband was a chef, said it had a good salisbury steak flavor. I want to make this for company next time. I'd say it's important to just brown the patties because they cook very nicely in the sauce, don't want to over cook them.

Very awesome. Easy to make. Prep time was good. I added a few things like garlic powder, minced onions, oregano and parsley. It all came together and tasted fantastic. It is going to be my comfort food of the future. I served with rice and veggies.
My family loved this! The only changes I made were I used a beefy onion soup mix and I doubled the recipe. I served it with mashed potatoes and peas. A great meal on a cold day!

Excellent, but did make some changes other reviewers suggested: Add a little garlic to the onions & mushrooms, substituted all beef broth/stock for the water and used just one skillet in order to get all the brown bits in the gravy. Perfect!

I made this last week and my family loved it! I did read reviews and used the idea of using golden mushroom soup, instead of flour and water. I also used baby Bella mushrooms. It was awesome. I served it with Basmati rice and broccoli. Big hit. Family wants it again next week. Thank you for such a yummy and easy recipe.
